text: But there are too many people that make so much money at the cost of lives of other humans and for no reason but to make the money.
author: Lily Tomlin

text: Thinking in its lower grades, is comparable to paper money, and in its higher forms it is a kind of poetry.
author: Havelock Ellis

text: Unfaithfulness in the keeping of an appointment is an act of clear dishonesty. You may as well borrow a person's money as his time.
author: Horace Mann

text: There's no money in poetry, but then there's no poetry in money, either.
author: Robert Graves

text: When I was waiting tables, washing dishes, or mowing lawns for money, I never thought of myself as stuck in some station in life. I was on my own path, my own journey, an American journey where I could think for myself, decide for myself, define happiness for myself.
author: Paul Ryan
